definition: to free from faults or defects: such as
to improve in manners or morals : reform
examples: was advised to mend his ways

definition: to put into good shape or working order again : patch up : repair
to improve or strengthen (something, such as a relationship) by negotiation or conciliation
examples: spends the weekend mending political fences
before the bone was fully mended

definition: to make amends or atonement for

examples: It's never too late to mend.
depression and lack of spirit mended visibly
